meanings.definition: A person who makes bookings or reservations.
meanings.sent1: The bookers at the hotel helped me reserve a room for my vacation.
meanings.sent2: The travel agency has experienced bookers who handle all the reservations.
meanings.sent3: The bookers at the restaurant were so busy that they accidentally booked a table for the wrong day.
meanings.sent4: She was the best booker in town, always managing to secure the best deals for her clients.
meanings.sent5: The bookers at the airline worked tirelessly to ensure all passengers had their seats confirmed.

meanings.definition: The act of making bookings or reservations.
meanings.sent1: Online bookers make it easy for customers to reserve tickets from the comfort of their homes.
meanings.sent2: The bookers for the event were overwhelmed with the number of reservations coming in.
meanings.sent3: The bookers for the concert had to deal with a sudden surge in ticket bookings.
meanings.sent4: The bookers worked efficiently to handle all the reservations before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The bookers managed to secure a booking at the popular restaurant despite the short notice.

meanings.definition: A group of people who make bookings or reservations.
meanings.sent1: The bookers in our team divided the tasks to ensure all reservations were made on time.
meanings.sent2: The bookers from different departments collaborated to handle the influx of bookings.
meanings.sent3: The bookers for the travel agency formed a tight-knit group to tackle the busy season.
meanings.sent4: The bookers worked together like a well-oiled machine to manage the reservations.
meanings.sent5: The bookers coordinated seamlessly to handle the high volume of bookings during the holiday season.
